fields.description:
I'm currently running a standalone version of JIRA on my RedHat machine
with about 5 users testing the system.  Up until now things have been
going very well and everyone likes it but just as I'm about to roll it
out to more users and start my pitch for finance to management, odd
things have started to happen.

In the list of issues there are now some blank lines.  I can click on
the blank space where the icon should be (on the left) but this errors
saying that the issue key or ID does not exist (the URL doesn't have a
an ID in it, just key= ).

Secondly when users create new issues the sometimes (getting more
regular now) get the message.

Form Errors: 
Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException

but often the issue is created anyway . . .

I'd be grateful for any help with this issue asap as I need to get it
working and pitch it to a director in the next couple of days!!!
fields.summary: Blank lines and NullPointer Exceptions

fields.description:
We have a load of intranet apps, an are considering a single-sign-on solution.
For J2EE these system follow two models:
 * Either through a servlet filter 
 * or a special hook (authenticate(thisServletRequest)) 
which for the application does not make much of a difference.
So it would help a lot if JIRA (and "the new one" ;-)) would support a configurable method to getTheUsersIdentity from an external system.

This should not be that big a deal, maybe it's even there - but then I would need a point where to look at. I haven't found it yet.
And yes, we presumably would build an integration with Yale's CAS.

 -- ingomar

fields.description:
You can't see issues of a project, if you delete its Issue Security Scheme (deleting issue security scheme directly in issue security scheme preview).

Issues still has deleted issue security scheme level.

My fix (it worked for me):

1. I created new issue security schem

2. I added new issue security scheme level

3. I changed id of previously create issue security scheme level
 in table schemeissuesecuritylevels (we use Oracle database). I setted it to value that I guessed is missing...


4. I added user group to issue security scheme level

Probably it could be done in better way?
fields.summary: Deleting Issue Security Scheme that still has projects

fields.description:
we've implemented a service to take change logs from our source control system (perforce) and put them in as comments. these are great to have inline, but if there was a way, I'd love to be able to separate these from the actual user-comments.

The way I'd envision it working is that you logically have three types of comments right now - "comment", "work log", and "change history". A custom comment type, e.g. "Email", "CVS", "Perforce" could be used and comments of that type would appear under that tab in the view issue page. Obviously it would be nice to be able to control who can set or modify the comment type, because we wouldn't want users to be able to enter 'CVS' or 'Perforce' comment types.

(forward thinking here... if someone had an email tab they could send email from an issue from within JIRA and have it attach the contents of the outbound email under the same tab -- this would be AWESOME for support/helpdesk usages)
fields.summary: comment types

fields.description:
After QA has verified a Issue it would be helpful to keep the issue editable and be able to forward it to our biling department. Effectively the life cycle would just extent to include billed, paid, etc AFTER fixed and verified.
Alternately if the workflow was exposed so that clients could extend it this would just be something we configure.
fields.summary: Allow for additional workflow / editing AFTER verification process
Bulk edit custom field values

fields.description:
Previously (version 2.3) if you were not logged in, and you clicked on the a link ponting to a certain issue (e.g. in the notification email) in your browser you were prompted to login. 

From 2.4.1 one gets an error message stating that the issue does not exist:

The issue key or ID that you entered does not exist in the system, or you do not have permission to view it.
Please check the key or ID you entered. 
View Issue #:
[View] (issue keys usually look like FOO-52)

The actual problem is that the user is not logged in and the text of the error message is missleading somewhat. After logging in the issue is accessible normally.

Are you planning to either implement the old method (prompting for login automatically) or present a specific error message (I would prefer the former)

Thanks:

Arpad

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2429].
  {panel}

*Update*: Great news for everyone watching this issue and especially for those that that voted on the ability to Bulk Watch a list of issues... we are resolving this as FIXED! 

Two of our awesome JIRA Engineers took this request on in a [ShipIt! project|http://www.atlassian.com/company/about/shipit] and we now bring it to you as part of the exciting JIRA 6.0 release (coming soon).

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 15 November 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.

While we don't have plans to address this feature in the next 12 months, we are keeping this on our roadmap and plan to address it in the future, along with other bulk actions like JRA-13245.

In the meantime, there are a number of possible solutions, including a [plugin on the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.bug-watcher] and several scripts offered by other customers in the comments below. Since these solutions are not available in JIRA OnDemand, we are keeping this in our roadmap and want to make sure all customers have access to a solution.

While we will not be addressing this feature request in the next 12 months, we plan to resolve several other top voted feature requests in the next 12 months, including JRA-3821, JRA-1549, JRA-5783, and JRA-7659. And we have recently resolved both JRA-19083 and JRA-7686, two other highly voted feature requests.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,

Bryan
JIRA Product Management
brollins at atlassian dot com

{panel}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2428].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 5 September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

While this suggestion has gathered significant interest, we are unable to implement all of the excellent suggestions you make. We don't plan to work on this for the foreseeable future. This suggestion will be reviewed in about 12 months time, at which point we will consider whether we need to alter its status. 
 We understand this decision will be disappointing to everyone who voted for this issue.

While we believe this suggestion would improve the product, after careful review of the most pressing needs of our customers, we've decided to prioritize other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, including:

For the near future, we've decided to prioritize some other areas of the Jira Server roadmap, including several highly-voted suggestions from you:
 * Further performance and stability improvements
 * Email notifications template editor available from the UI JRASERVER-7266
 * Jira email notifications batching JRASERVER-1369
 * Mobile app for Jira Server JRASERVER-46149
 * Improved filter and dashboard management by Jira administrators JRASERVER-15900 and JRASERVER-41269 
 * Adding the "updated-by" JQL search query JRASERVER-1973
 * Support for 4 byte characters in MySQL connection JRASERVER-36135

In the recent Jira Server releases we have also shipped some highly-voted features and improvements, including:
 * Filters and dashboards collaborative editing
 * Selectable delimiters in CSV export 
 * Microsoft SQL Server 2016 support 
 * iPv6 support
 * Faster Kanban boards
 * Refreshed projects and custom fields management pages in the admin's section 
 * We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can learn more about our approach to highly voted server suggestions here.

We hope that you appreciate our candid and transparent communication. You can learn more about our [approach to highly voted server suggestions here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117].

To learn more on how you suggestions are reviewed, see our [updated workflow for server feature suggestions|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/An-updated-workflow-for-Server-feature-suggestions/ba-p/721632#M113].

Kind regards,

Jira Server Product Management
{panel}
*Original request description (original description was blank, so let's use one of the duplicates' description for clarity):*

It would be handy to have the possibility to bulk change the type of one, more or all issue links when viewing the "link administration" of a certain issue. E.g. when one wants to change all "subissues" to "related issues". Now this can only be achieved by removing the links and recreating them as the new link types.

fields.description:
The scheduler runs properly every x minutes.  The problem is that the job takes a minute or two to run.  This means that the job starts at a different time each and every time it runs.  I'm having difficulty assigning a backup time because at some point, the backup tasks are going to run at the same time as JIRA's scheduler and I'm going to get a conflict.

Can we change the scheduler to work more like cron?  Or, at the very least specify start time(s) instead of number of minutes.


Thanks,
fields.summary: Quartz Scheduler runs job at different time each day.

fields.description:
Scott,

I was not clear in our need, sorry for the confusion.

In some of the projects, we have lots of issues. If I want a single summary of these issues today, I have to go to "unscheduled" then pick one of the reports (e.g., Excel). The problem with this is that such reports do not have a "component" column and therefore we end up with a randomized list of issues on a long (possibly multi page) Exel. It would be much preferable if such Excel reports captured the "Component" information and either in Jira or in Excel, I could order the issues on the Excel summary by Component.

PS. Of course, I can also go to each component and get a special report. But then, we may end up having to collate dozens of Excel reports for one project.

In short: can the component name added as a column in the output of IssueNavigator.jspa?
fields.summary: Components in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2414].
  {panel}

all our projects have the same set of permissions, however, we have to implement a distinct permission scheme for each project, because we have "project groups" where only users assigned to that project can edit/schedule/assign/assignable/resolve issues.

this means creating a separate permission scheme for each project, copying another, and removing one set of groups and adding another.

if 'project group' were an option on the Add New Permission page, this would greatly simplify our administration. one way to make this work would be that if project-group were seleted, anyone in a group with the SAME NAME as the project would be given that permission.

alternately, the database structure could be modified to allow assigning one (add fk) or more than one (new table), but this would probably be a lot more work.
fields.summary: add "project group" feature to ease permissions management

fields.description:
The date displayed in the 'Due Date' field of the issue edit form does not conform to the server-wide configured date format. It represents the correct date but it confuses some users who aren't Australian (or Europoean or...).

Note that it *does* display in the proper format when the issue is being displayed rather than edited.

fields.description:
JIRA does not seem to be capable of filtering by Component.
Is there a way to add this capability?

fields.description:
Looked at some source codes and found places with comments at class level like this: "To change this template use Options | File Templates." "To change template for new class use
 * Code Style | Class Templates options (Tools | IDE Options)." Please check your source code.
fields.summary: Code style is not consistent

fields.description: It would be very nice to have an option to (for example) close several issues at once. From within a search for example
fields.summary: Bulk updated issues

fields.description:
When browsing through a component the list returned by /secure/IssueNavigator.jspa
shows incorrect dates in the "update" column. I expect it to be the date of the last update (comment, etc). Instead it is always the same date as the Create column (left to it).

Am I misunderstunding the concept here?
fields.summary: update date is incorrect in IssueNavigator

fields.description:
If a JIRA administrator is busy reindexing the data and another user creates a new issue, this data is not searchable.  An error like this appears in catalina.out:

2003-09-26 14:49:53,729 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Giving up reindex - waited 10 seconds

As a related issue, searches during a reindex return a variable number of results, depending on how far the reindex has gotten.

A reindex fixes both issues.
fields.summary: Issue edits during reindex are not visible
Cost Accounting

fields.description:
Just in the process of evaluating JIRA, but I (and my users) would like inline display of attachments if possible.
Perhaps only certian mime types (jpgs/bmps/other images) ie for displaying screenshots/mockups, and only if the image fits sensible size contstraints (ie not bigger than a certian height/width or file size).

This may already have been requested, but I couldn't see anything when searching your issue database. It would save a lot of time to have the screenshot immediatley available rather than have to hit 'open' and flick between an image viewer and the issue record.
fields.summary: Inline display of attachments

fields.description:
I back up JIRA database every 12 hours, but the *.zip filenames have the same value for hour (without am/pm notification). If, by any chance, two consecutive backups are done at the same minute, the first file could get overwritten.

   1623492 Sep 23 14:08 2003.09.23:02:08.zip
   1625053 Sep 24 02:11 2003.09.24:02:09.zip
   1636647 Sep 24 14:12 2003.09.24:02:12.zip
   1643594 Sep 25 02:15 2003.09.25:02:13.zip
   1654189 Sep 25 14:16 2003.09.25:02:16.zip
fields.summary: Automated xml backup files are not labeled in 24 hour format
It should be possible for a project administrator to see their own schemes

fields.description:
This problem has been described in previously created issues, but they do not take into consideration the whole aspect of the problem. Therefore this (half duplicated) issue.

When displaying Notification or Permission Schemes (this is everywhere: in select boxes, administration pages, etc.) they are both displayed in a random order. They should of cause be ordered (e.g. alphabetically)

The other issues that concentrates on part of this problem is:
JRA-1420: Notification or Permission Schemes administration
JRA-2187: Permission Schemes administration
JRA-2261: Permission Schemes administration
JRA-2263: Permission Scheme select boxes

The idea of this issue is to concentrate all of the above in one issue + add new aspects of the problem. Btw: None of the above issues has yet been linked. This should probably also be done.
fields.summary: Notification and Permission Schemes should be sorted (everywhere)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2398].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This issue has been open for 12 years, and as of April 2015 we still have no plans to support NTLM authentication natively in JIRA. We do plan to continue investing in improving support for external directory configurations in JIRA, however we want to focus on improving our support for the current set of configurations.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description:*

Support NTLM authentication instead of password login when appropriate. This is attractive, even more as Mozilla 1.4 supports it.

*Workaround:*

Customers have reported in past comments like [this one|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2398?focusedCommentId=522893&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-522893] or [this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Problems+Connecting+to+the+Atlassian+Marketplace] that they were successful once they installed [Cntlm Authentication Proxy|http://cntlm.sourceforge.net/] locally to their JIRA server, [configured and tested it|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9181637/how-to-fill-proxy-information-in-cntlm-config-file] to make sure "Cntlm" works with their corporate NTLM and then used the parameters documented in [How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Configure+an+Outbound+HTTP+and+HTTPS+Proxy+for+JIRA] to point to the "Cntlm" proxy instead - and that one will do the job to talk to NTLM.

More detailed steps can be found on [How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Configure+an+Outbound+HTTP+and+HTTPS+Proxy+for+JIRA].
fields.summary: Support NTLM authentication

fields.description: I have created several issues lately and received email confirmations.  When I go back later and look at the issues, either the whole issue has disappeared or some of the comments have. This is by no means consistent - many issues are fine, on the same project, from the same user.  Another may only lose individual comments or the entire issue may disappear.  ???
fields.summary: Issues disappear shortly after creation despite mail confirmation

fields.description: Today you need the "Delete Issue" permission to delete attachments. It would be nice with a special "Delete Attachments" permission
fields.summary: Special Delete Attachments permission

fields.description:
In the "Manage Attachments" section in an issue the text "This page allows you to manage the attachments for a particular issue. Only developers can delete attachments" is kind of misleading. It says that only developers can delete. As far as I see it only user with administrative privileges to the project can do this.

Btw: It would be nice if there was a special permission controlling if a user could delete attachments (and comments for that matter), just as there is for "Delete Issues".
fields.summary: Misleading text under Manage Attachments

fields.description: Today the only way to change the default attachment size limit is to edit the webwork.properties file. This means to restart JIRA. It would be nice if this limit could be changed directly and dynamicly from the JIRA user interface so no restart is needed.
fields.summary: Change attachment size limit in the Web Interface / GUI

fields.description: We can use a new custom field type of User List for assigning Pairs to a development task - just for tracking purposes only.
fields.summary: New Custom Field Type of User

fields.description: we plan to use custom fields to track which build number that fixes are put in to assist our QA folks. this isn't feasible unless we can bulk-edit the custom field to set the value, because all the issues fixed when a build is created will need to be assigned to the same value.
fields.summary: bulk editing of custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2391].
  {panel}

The time report is great, but we have a hard time getting people to remember to track their time as they go. If an issue spans over the course of a week, we never get the time entered, and some people never enter it at all.

What we need is the ability to see a time report per developer, and perhaps for a group of developers (as a printable report, it would be great if a new page break was added for each new developer).

Or we could just have a filtered time report. That is, add a checkbox or someting to add time tracking fields/summaries to any filter.

(I could swear I saw this issue somewhere else but I haven't been able to find it since then, so I guess I'll submit it now just in case I'm remembing incorrectly.)
fields.summary: developer time report

fields.description:
JellyTag is CreateUser, not AddNewUser as mentioned in the examples here:

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v2.4.1/jelly.html?clicked=jirahelp#AddUserToGroup

fields.description:
After creating an issue, I can click start progress succesfully but the issue then shows both start and stop progress links. Clinking on either results in this exception:

No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]

The requested resource (No view for result [error] exists for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]) is not available.

It also seems to me that if an issue has started, then it shouldn't have the Start Progress link visible.

Channing
fields.summary: Start/Stop progress causing tomcat error

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to suspend an issue and reactivate it on a triggered event. The event could typically be a timer (re-activate on given date) or an event triggered by another issue.
It would be particulary useful for issues with linked dependencies.
E.g. Issue A depends on issue B, suspend issue A until issue B is resolved, and then re-activate it.
fields.summary: New status type on issue: SUSPENDED

fields.description:
I keep getting this form error when creating a new bug for a project:

Form Errors: 
An exception occurred: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: isHasIssuePermission can only take an Issue: Project is not..

I get this error when I set the due date to todays/current date. The error is gone if set the due date to a later date.
fields.summary: Setting due date to the current date shows error

fields.description:
Has been working for months now ... Using the Administration user interface to create an Export : Form Errors: An exception occurred backing up: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@159a690, result: error
Error exporting: java.io.IOException: The character '�' is an invalid XML character The export service now is unable to export (neither using the administration user interface). Is there a way to figure out which data is incorrect? Turned on debugging (will attach log) on the server but could not figure out. Looks like an encoding problem. We are using ISO-8859-1 in Jira and the Oracle9i database.
fields.summary: Export Error - Invalid XML character

fields.description:
This is a feature that helps when you are using JIRA in an environment where you have many different released and support versions of your projects and you're managing codelines and branches pretty tightly.

Basically I would like JIRA to have an option to branch a version that would kinda mimic how you branch code.  The actual operation would require JIRA to update the Fix-For's of any issue in the branched version.  For example:

You have version 1.0.0 and you have released it and now you must branch off 1.0.0 for maintenance and maintain a development branch for say 2.0.0.  

The concern with this is that any bugs that in the current 1.0.0 version are being carried over into 2.0.0 code but if you just create a version in JIRA, the new 2.0.0 version will not reflect those bugs.

If you could tell JIRA to branch 1.0.0, create a new 2.0.0 version AND modify any currently open issue for 1.0.0 so that its Fix-For includes 1.0.0 and 2.0.0.  

The only other caveat is that I would like the ability to do this with two existing versions.  Its common for us to create the version in JIRA before the code is branched.  So I'd like to take the 1.0.0 and say it was branched to (select the existing version, i.e. 2.0.0).  Then it would basically do the same thing, all 1.0.0 issues would get 2.0.0 appended to the Fix-For.
fields.summary: In Versions, add ability to branch

fields.description:
{panel}
*CURRENT STATUS* Atlassian is actively working on a major improvement to installation and upgrade. This work will result in us resolving this issue as FIXED. Your votes and comments are not something we can always individually comment on, so if you really just want to know if we're making this a priority, then be assured the answer is *YES* and the results will be shipped in 2011. _Chris Mountford_
{panel}

Build an semi-automated upgrade tool which retains all settings, such as database connection and directories. The administrator should be able to download an upgrade tool, point it at an installation and only be prompted about which plugins they wish to install along with their versions.

This should make use of one-click plugin installer that looks up the plugin website for versions listed as compatible with the current JIRA version, similar to the Confluence Repository Client, then returns the download URLs and versions for all compatible releases of each plugin. It does not need to care about source-code modifications. 

There should be a one-click upgrade button in the System Administration tool. 

The tools should check for correct database access rights and request them if denied
fields.summary: Upgrade tool for JIRA Standalone with automated plugin download and installation

fields.description:
We could significantly improve the view profile screen.

* redo the layout to make it more user friendly
* provide more statistics about the user (user for X period, # logins etc)
* provide links to useful filters about the user (issues reported, issues assigned)
* allow users to specify a profile of themselves (piece of HTML displayed on that page) - this enables them to provide links to their homepage etc.
fields.summary: Improve view profile screen

fields.description:
The admin interface for adding custom priorities should include a color picker similar to the look and feel page. This will allow users to specify a color for each priority in the graph. 

Priorities also need to be sorted differently (not by their id's alone). Currently, new custom priorities do not appear in the correct order.
fields.summary: Custom priorities do not show up correctly on project portlet graph

fields.description:
We should try{} catch{} around each individual portlet, and show a blank portlet box if there is an exception thrown.

The exception should be logged, the cause shown in the portlet box.

This will prevent people having problems accessing JIRA if their dashboard is broken.
fields.summary: Portlet Exceptions shouldn't cause the dasboard to hang

fields.description:
When creating or updating an issue, a completely bogus date, such as 0035-01-24) can be entered.  In the CreateIssue page, this results in an indexing exception.  In the Update page, it lets this bogus date through.  Then when an admin tries to reindex the data, the reindex dies with an error:

#  Exception reindexing: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException: Error: java.lang.RuntimeException: time too early: time too early

And in the stdout logs (logs/catalina.out):
WARN [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] There was an exception whilst reindexing issue XYZ-291java.lang.RuntimeException: time too early

Fortunately the stdout logs (to logs/catalina.out) contain the affected key (XYZ-291 above).  The workaround is to fix the due date in the database.  This can be done by either:

 - Create an XML export (backup) of the database
 - Edit the XML, search for something like:

<Issue assignee="jsmith" created="2003-08-22 23:16:47.0" duedate="0035-01-24 00:00:00.0" ...

   Fix the duedate attribute, and import the XML.

Or:

 - In the database, run the query:

update jiraissue set duedate='2004-01-24 00:00:00.0' where pkey='XYZ-291';
fields.summary: "time too early" errors on reindex: Due date field not checked for sanity when creating/editing issues

fields.description:
There are two minor bugs with Issue Security Levels at the moment.

1. You cannot make the default level 'none'. We need a new link at the top (in the JIRA panel) to "Make default 'no level'"

2. The default level still has a 'Default' link in the operations column. If the current level is the default this link should not show up.
fields.summary: Minor bugs with Issue Security Levels

fields.description:
Currently, to allow users / project leads etc. to delete attachments, you have to give them the delete issue permission (even in Enterprise version.  

Deleting attachments is not a big deal, as doing so leaves an audit trail (in Change History).  

However this permission also allows deleting issues completely which removes any audit trail.  

An alternate would be to make "delete issue" be a logical delete - ie: flag in the database rather than physically deleting.
fields.summary: Separate "delete attachment" permission
should be able to login only via https

fields.description:
Today everybody can see time estimates made on an issue. It would be nice if it was possible (for example via the permission scheme) to determine who should be able see them.

An idea to the level of permissions could be:
- Edit others time estimates
- Add/Edit own time estimates
- View time estimates

This could also help another issue: That an administrator maybe doesn't want to enable time tracking on all projects. With the above solution the administrator can just choose not to set any Time Tracking permissions on the projects that shouldn't use Time Tracking.

/watson
fields.summary: Hide Time Tracking estimates from certain users (e.g. customers)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2351].
  {panel}

We deploy our installation on several sites. We have mainly one Jira user per site where we deploy our system. That may change in the future. This person represents the customer for that site.

Sometimes she reports a bug/problem by phone, sometimes she fills the report. We want to be able to track feature request per site.

I cannot use 'reported by' as we sometimes fill the report in for the user.
I cannot use the voting, because I cannot see what this person has voted for.
I cannot use custom fields, as I would have to go behind every bug and check whether that particular bug has been requested by a user/site. Jira is supposed to be there for it.

The information is there, but I don't seem to be able to find a way to retrieve it.

The simplest seems to be to use both the reported by and voting mecanism: the issues reported by a customer are the sum of these two queries. But there's no way right now to search the issues a user voted for.

Thus if we could either haev this possibility to search by user votes.
In one way it is the 'reverse' query of JRA-1000. We search per user instead of per issue.
fields.summary: user-issue mapping improments - see what user has voted for?

fields.description:
Problem: Comment not being added if issue assigned to same user as current assignee.

Steps to reproduce:

Issue was reported and assigned to use "terry".

Clicked "Assign user", and assigned issue to "terry".

Added comment.

Clicked Save.

Result: Comment not added.
Expected Result: Comment added.


Note: I realize this is an unusual situation, as I should have just used the "comment on this issue" functionality.  However, I did not realize that the issue was already assigned to the developer, and Jira should never discard user entered data.
fields.summary: Comment not saved when assigning issue to same user

Please help!!
